Had the buffet...absolutely terrible.  Not sure where the get the beef from but really tough

After eating here several times - finally, a review.  This place is good!  What do I like about La Fonda Del Sol, you ask?  Well, first, it definitely has an ol' family restaurant, cantina-dive vibe.  Second - chips are brought to the table with two carafes of salsa and the chips are always HOT.  I mean HOT.  And Fresh - if not needing just a little salt.  Salsas are both delicious, and fresh.  (One of my favorite new "F" words.). Queso is delicious, and tip/note - comes with freshly made flour tortilla chips, not corn as is served HOT and complimentary with salsa.  Obviously a crowd pleaser because every table around me ordered the queso.  Third - Food comes out quickly, and also HOT.  Can't touch the plate hot.  And how do they make it stay hot for so long?  I have ordered a number of dishes but still come back to the chicken chimi with cream cheese.  I love cream cheese, and it is a different and tasty addition.  Seriously, I think there are three shredded/chunked chicken breasts wrapped in a deep fried pillow of delicious, then smothered with green sauce and melted cheese.  I have noticed they don't call it green chili on the menu, and it really isn't traditional green chili.  It is delicious though, and obviously made fresh from fire roasted green chilis.  Not too pepper hot - just the right "kick."  Tasty retried beans; and rice.  Some may complain about the price, but for me each dish is at least two meals - so worth it from my perspective.    What to watch out for?  It gets crowded, and L-O-U-D.  Service is typically good, but I am not sure how they "assign" tables.  We typically have to wait to be first greeted, but then it stays pretty consistently attentive.  I have never been in the bathrooms, so can't speak to them, but the place is clean-ish.  Not dirty; just not confidently clean.  There were a couple of used napkins on the floor under my table, and I had to brush crumbs off my chair.  Not a big deal though.  The entry is not inviting.  In fact, it's a bit scuzzy.    Lastly, my only and completely random complaint, that they can really do nothing about (and it isn't deterring me from going back) - when you leave, you and your clothes are going to smell like you've been immersed in onion-grease-Mexican-corn-salsa-dip.  Not sure why or what it is because it isn't a prevalent smell or Odor inside - but trust me, you're going to smell it until the clothes and hair are washed.  All in all a good spot for tasty Mexican food!

Loved this small, intimate place. Great service.  Margaritas were prepared by the bartender and not pre-made. We ordered the green corn tamale, shrimp enchilada, beef tacos and chicken enchilada all with green chili. Generous portions. Hot sauce is hot and spicy as it should be. They offer a mild salsa as well. Only criticism is the hard taco shells seemed a little tough and were served in the enchilada sauce on the same plate so we're soft on the bottom. Definitely a place to keep on our list of favorites!

Refried beans are awesome - best in the Valley!  Their hot sauce is terrific, but my husband wasn't a huge fan of the regular salsa.  The front entrance could definitely use some brightening up a bit, but don't let that deter you!  Give this place a shot!

I got take out and it was overwhelming awesome! I got free chips and three salsas, guacamole, sour cream, and pick de gallo included with no charge and the shrimp and steak fajitas were just delicious! I'm definitely getting this again.
Wonderful service - Brittany even asked our names and used them the entire dinner.  Wow!  We loved the warm chips and great salsa, my chimichanga was yum!  Will be heading there again!
This is the 2nd time this week while in Phoenix on business. From chips and salsa, to food and drink and service? EXCELLENTE!

I wanted to like this place...really, I did!  After reading reviews and looking at pictures, I had to try it.  The chips and salsa--very good!  The carne asada--not good.  At all.  It was very salty and kind of gross.  Instead of serving it like a steak (like I'm used to), it was cut up for me...I felt like I was 5 years old and not allowed to touch a knife.  I feel bad because our server was so nice!  I wish I could give 5 stars for the server alone, but unfortunately I went there for carne asada, not the waitress!
Fajitas with burnt vegetables and a chx quesadilla with 8# of cheese, zero vegetables. I'll pass.

We have been here a few times before and just realized ive never left a review for them.  This place is truly a diamond in the rough for Scottsdale hidden on Scottdale and Shea.   The salsa Is flavorful and fresh, sooo good. My favorite is the chicken fundido, highly recommend. I posted a pic too.  Staff is attentive and at 6:30 there are few booths available,  don't let that discourage you.... Just tells you its great.  I know another post commented on the ventilation,  no idea wth they are talking about. Place does not smell, it's old but it's clean. Try it... It's worth my 20 min drive!
Food is decent.  We like the cheese enchiladas.  Service pleasant.  Atmosphere rather "hole in the wall".   Prices are too high for this type of place.

We were in the mood for some Mexican food and stumbled across this joint.  It's a casual dining place with 15 or so tables and a small bar.  Complimentary Chips & Salsa are included with your meal.  They give you 2 types of Salsa.....Mild and Spicy.   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HTlsBAd9j1wlWDHxnYczBw?select=7TDycarU8SKS1PQzilc2_w The Spicy Salsa is very good.....the Chips are very thin and break easily....so they got 1/2 of that right. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HTlsBAd9j1wlWDHxnYczBw?select=9NUxLme4YMrPXxSrw5vkHw  For dinner we ordered:  Cheese Crisp Appetizer - $7.25 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HTlsBAd9j1wlWDHxnYczBw?select=W6kOQlY8S8ke97Of4UQkFg #11 Cheese Enchilada Combo (Enchilada, Beans, Rice) - $11.50 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HTlsBAd9j1wlWDHxnYczBw?select=UJEi2YPoYm73iJrXOdz1lA Carnitas Burrito - $9 http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HTlsBAd9j1wlWDHxnYczBw?select=1_A4f--rniKJFcd3UfGG5A Side of Sour Cream - $1.35 2 Glasses of House Cabernet - $6.75  The Cheese Crisp was very good.  It's like an open faced Quesadilla with the Tortilla cooked nice and crispy.  The Cheese Enchilada was OK....kind of salty.  The Better Half enjoyed her Carnitas Burrito, but she said it wasn't anything special.  She only ate 1/2 of it....took the other 1/2 home.  The glasses of Wine was hers also....and thought it was ok, what could you expect from house Wine?  Overall, it was an OK dinner....did not 'wow' us.  Return Factor - 40%

Great food, great salsa and surprisingly good coffee at a very reasonable price (make that a low price if you are going for lunch between 11am-4pm).  La Fonda Del Sol is by no means elegant, but that doesn't seem to be the point of this place, i.e. it doesn't need to be.  It's definitely worth checking out if you're in the mood for good non-corporate chain Mexican food.  P.S. Although I've not yet had a chance to try the margaritas (and I hate to post hearsay) they come highly recommended from what I would call a "trusted source." I'll update when I have personal knowledge.
So good. Cheap, delicious, authentic, no frills. Very kind staff. Nice outdoor covered patio in the back. Best nachos of my life.

The service was excellent but the food was terrible! And overpriced!! Possibly the worst mexican food I have ever eaten. We ordered a beef taco, a beef flauta, a chimichanga meal and guacamole. The guac was decent but very tiny portion. All the meats tasted like they were just boiled in water, completely flavourless. Cannot recommend this place to anyone.

The service was good and they were able to seat a larger group pretty easily. Chips and salsa are great, just try not to fill up on them. The food was good and the chimichanga I had was great. Carnitas are large chunks of well seasoned and cooked pork! I loved it. No one was raving about their dishes but all seemed to like them. I would go hear again if I were in that area.

My favorite Mexican food anywhere, not just in AZ! They have the best chips and salsa and their shredded beef enchiladas and shrimp enchiladas are unbeatable as well!  I'm sure other menu items are equally amazing, but those are so delicious that I can't bring myself to try other things. The service has always been extremely warm and friendly.  Truly a gem!!
We had two chicken chimichangas.  They were huge and absolutely delicious!  The salsa and chips were fresh and delicious!  Great place!
I got street tacos ordered from ubereats and they were good-fresh tortilla, good salsa, and meat was ok, but very small for the price. I was a bit disappointed with the size.
A great authentic and affordable, reasonably priced Mexican restaurant.

Have been coming here since I was my kids age and its still a family favorite.  The food is very good and has been consistent over the years.  We have never ordered anything that we didn't enjoy.   The only thing I noted yesterday was the cheese crisp was 'runny' and not spread or cut evenly...I think it came out too early.  Also they used to bring the hot salsa out in a full container and now only do half; that said, they gladly bring more.  (Chips and salsa are excellent.)  Most of the servers have been there 'forever' and the owners is always around and active.   When we arrived yesterday they weren't busy, so service started out good.   However, in the next half an hour they filled to capacity and they weren't staffed for it, so it was very difficult to get prompt or attentive service from that point forward.  The atmosphere is where they suffer a bit.  The restaurant hasn't been updated in years and their is quite a bit of wear and tear.   But the oddest part, that I noticed today, and then when I read other reviews, is that something about the ventilation system means your clothes end up smelling really strongly of the kitchen.   I don't know what they can do about that without closing down for a significant remodel and none of us locals want that.

I came to this place based on the reviews and the pictures that looked pretty good, however, that was not the case. This place is by far the worst Mexican food restaurant that I have ever tried, def. not authentic Mexican food. We ordered chicken and the chicken was so burnt that it was so hard. The fries were also burnt that they were just stiff. The carne asada burrito tasted like old meat and over used oil and the tortillas were terrible.

When I'm traveling to AZ I'm always on the hunt for good Mexican food. La Fonda Del Sol did not disappoint. We were there on a Monday nite, so it wasn't too busy. We were seated quickly. Almost as we sat down the chips ( warm and fresh) and salsa were served. 2 different salsa, one a little  more spicy than the other, mixed together, it was great.  I ordered the cheese enchilada and tamale combo. These are 2 of my Mexican favorites. My plate was hot, the food was hot and again we didn't wait long for the meals to arrive. My husband ordered the beef burrito and he said it was also very good. The Burrito was pretty big, and neither of us left hungry. We also ordered the Fried Ice Cream, once again it was very good..  We will definitely visit La Fonda Del Sol again.

Have to say how thoroughly impressed we all were with La Fonda!! And, when I say "we" I mean our party of 35 people ...teenagers and parents after a soccer league tournament with most guests here from other states. First off, they gladly took our reservation and our nice long table was set and easy to go when we arrived. Second, as the group filtered in they were quick to take our drink orders (BTW margaritas are perfectly mixed), and third, the owner, Roman, managed to effortlessly take everyone's order with having to keep track of managing about 10 different checks!!! The food (which was amazing!!!) came out fast, hot, and perfect!! With all the noise and chaos amidst our own group, there were 2 orders miscommunicated, but, they fixed everything quickly and were all too glad to make everything perfect. We had so many different items ordered, but everyone had nothing but smiles, compliments and empty plates at the end (even with the huge portions)...it was just that hard to stop eating. I personally had the spinach enchiladas and they were divine! Fresh chips, home made salsas and sauces, warm and gracious staff all added to an unforgettable group dinner! We will definitely be back!!!

Oreganos was full so we meandered over here. I ordered the large taco salad which came in a small bowl and was half water. It looked like bag salad covered in cafeteria junk. My kids pizzas were super mini Tostinos pizza pockets out of a box. Overall, the average age of customers was around 80 ... and mostly because they have probably all lost their taste buds.

Love this place!!  The food is spot on and the service is always perfect!  I normally get the combo which has a beef enchilada, beef tamale and a beef taco!! I have three words to describe it: FAB-U-LOUS!!!!! The margaritas aren't bad either!!! Oh Yeah! The chips and salsa are awesome!!

I went here last night with 2 girlfriends for a celebratory occasion. We were seated in a booth and promptly served warm tortilla chips (homemade) with 2 little carafes of salsa (one was pico de gallo and the other was a spicier).  I ordered the 2 Tamale dinner and was a tad disappointed as there was so much melted cheese and grease, I couldn't even "find" the 2 alleged tamales?! I did sample my friend's dinner (2 beef tacos) and the beef was perfectly seasoned and not too dry - great job!!   The service was friendly and attentive - I may go back here but definitely would order something else. I came home smelling of Mexican restaurant, and the smell was still lingering in my car the following morning driving to work?
Another great Mexican spot in Arizona.  Does it ever get bad here??  Love this place, read many great reviews and finally stopped by and had a wonderful, flavorful meal.

Night before we went to The Mission. Supposedly the groovy food for Mex. too weird for me After drinks at Maestros we needed food! La Fonda is the bomb!  Roach atmosphere but awesome chow! Green Chili Burrito and Chicken Enchiladas  Cadillac Margarita  and Negro Modelo Sleeping well tonight

Food was pretty good, but the time it took from ordering my dinner till it came to me was unacceptable.  Wasn't worth the 35 minute wait.  Yes the place was crowded, but how long does it take to build one taco and assemble a chicken enchilada in a Mexican restaurant.

Got a chimmy from here for lunch it was really great I would recommend this place to anyone that's in the hood. Chips came out super hot which was great salsa they bring to your table was really good and the food was ready really fast what more do you want. If it was dinner I would have gotten a margarita but had to be back at work.
Consistently outstanding Sonoran Mexican Food. Always consistent and great service. Machaca is outstanding as is the grilled shrimp burrito

Best Salsa in town , hands down. I could literally drink a vat of this stuff.  Not a gourmet meal, but I've never had a bad one here and I've been coming here 1x per month for the past 20 years.  Carnitas or carne asada  hard shell tacos are my suggestion.

Their chips and salsa are the best I've had! The chips come with a bottle of regular salsa and hot salsa, and they are generous to refill anything you need! The regular salsa is chock full of tomatoes, onions, cilantro...yum....mix in some of the hotter salsa on your plate and it's perfect!   I had their 2 chicken enchilada plate, no beans extra rice. It was really good, although it was cubes of chicken, rather than shredded chicken which I'm used to. Tasty, nonetheless, lol I'm just being overly picky :P Their rice was cooked well, and it came with a nice little side of lettuce and tomatoes.  All in all, a great plate of food! It was a tiny bit pricey...around $13.  But I really enjoyed my food! Service was great. My sister-in-law and I went on a Sunday afternoon around 3pm, and there were only a few other tables. They don't have horchata though :(

Large place and quite busy when we arrived, but ample staff provided fast and friendly service.  Great salsa (the fresh, chunky, non-spicy one of the two small carafes bright to the table).  Salsa and tortilla chips seemed infinitely refillable. Shrimp fajitas were delicious. "Checking in" on Yelp got me a free soft drink which was refilled for free as well.  Husband enjoyed large selection of beers to choose from.  Spanish rice was the best I've tasted (I usually have one bite and don't eat any more).  I appreciated the fact that salsa, rice, refried beans and guacamole were not at all spicy; other folks can always add hot sauce!  A great find on our unexpected one night in Scottsdale due to a cancelled flight.
Some of the best Mexican food around! Their chicken quesadilla is TO DIE FOR. Service could be better, but the amazing food makes up for it!
I have not even eaten yet but the hospitality is 5 stars. Their salsas are great and everyone has a genuine smile for you !  Ok food is here and the tamales are yummy and comforting
I've been coming here for years. The staff treats everyone like family and I wouldn't go anywhere else in scottsdale for Mexican food. absolutely love it

So I am very picky about my Mexican food & to be honest the ONLY reason we came to this place is because Oregano's was on their usual 50 hr wait. I was pretty scared when we walked up to it, and was just as scared when we were seated.  Before we got a chance to situate ourselves water & chips & salsa were in front of us.  The chips & salsa were good, not amazing but it was good & i had my fair share of them. I was VERY impressed with our servers speed & attention.  The entree prices are kinda pricey...meaning $11-$13 a plate but we ordered them anyway.  To my surprise the food was GREAT! I don't remember the name of the plate I ordered but it had an enchilada, a taco, & a tamale.  EVERYTHING was good! I mean, not blow your mind you'll never have anything better than this again, but it was very tasty.  If we ever have to long of a wait at Oregano's again, we will return.  However we live in Phoenix so the chances of us being in Scottsdale again just for Mexican food are slim.  But I would recommend it to anyone who wants good food & speedy service.

I went to La Fonda Del Sol with a group of 14.  We were put in a room that was acoustically challenging.  Voices just bounced off the walls so you could here anyone talk.  I ordered the beef taco and cheese enchilada.  Boy have I tasted better.  The beef was greasy and tasted kind of foul.  The cheese enchilada was drowning in cheese that I couldn't find the enchilada.  Oh, the refried beans???  Canned.  Yuck.  Someone asked for another tortilla and they were charged $3.00.  They were not told by the waitress that there would be an extra charge.  And when the person asked about the charge the assistant manager came over and actually started arguing with the person.  Such poor customer service for a darn tortilla.  Expensive for the low quality of food.  I definitely will not be going back.
There is no better tasting Mexican food , this gem of a place will always have me bringing my friends
The server Chris was so nice and helpful. He recommended the fajitas. They were absolutely fantastic. Excellent prices too.

Came here for lunch with a co-worker. Started with chips and 2 kinds of salsa. One was a traditional mild salsa, the other was blazing hot, which made me very happy. The beef enchilada was awesome. I ordered 1 a la carte, and it was plenty of food. My co-worker had beef flautas and loved them. We arrived just as they opened, and when we left, the place was packed. Obviously the locals know it's great authentic Mexican food.
Super food.  Always crowded, but the staff get you seated and fed.  Order the pitcher of beer to save a bundle.

Went on a busy Saturday night and was able to get a table with no wait. Service was good and fast. Salsa and chips were fresh and tasty. Went with the servers recommendation and got the Toppopo Salad. Chicken was seasoned well and the salad dressing was light and very good.

Met some friends last night for dinner.  Greeted promptly, great little outside seating area.  Cold beers, crisp chips, fresh and delicious salsa.   Ordered a simple Carne Asada burro with some pico inside.  My wife ordered the Miniature Combo. Both were excellent.  Great place for North Scottsdale.  Oh yeah, very reasonable prices!!!  Cheers
Second visit here and food was just as good. Service was a little slow for Saturday at 3 but was with a larger group so it wasn't as big if a deal.

This is my go to spot as a late night eatery. They really aren't that many places in Phoenix they're open 24 /7 that you can get a decent meal.  The many tacos are delicious and the seafood quesadilla could feed an entire family. I'm never had a bad meal here and considering the options around the area it's always a reasonably priced and delicious choice.
We arrived at 11 am just as they were putting out the fresh hot buffet. The buffet is absolutely amazing and delish and as always the service is prompt and friendly

We ended up here because it was almost 9PM on a week night.  First time and we had a bogo coupon from the entertainment guide as well.  We both loved everything.  Being the last customers for the night I totally expected the staff to be butthurt but they weren't.  Everyone we encountered smiled and was friendly.  Several other tables emptied and it was close to closing time, the mop never came out, they didn't start flipping the chairs upside down on the tables. I had the La Fonda Chimi which was wonderful.  He had the chicken fajitas and they came with the usual on a separate plate. I loved the guacamole and the salsa. The chips were hot and fresh. I will definitely be back!

Some of the best Mexican food I've had.  We had take out with tacos which were to die for and steak fajitas with lime.  The Salsa is excellent with medium mixed with hot.  We went there on recommendation by Luis Gonzalez. Rename the Fajitas to "Gonzo Fajitas".

Very good authentic Mexican food. I tend to judge authenticity and goodness of Mexican food by a) how much beans, rice, and cheese do they pile on, and b) if I ate nothing but beans and rice, would it be delicious? The answers here are a) plenty and b) yes! I bought a sampler with an enchilada and a taco. The taco was one of those homestyle kind, where they start with a soft tortilla and fry it into shape until it's crispy. The setting is only so-so, it's a narrow dining room with not a lot of variety of seating options. The price was quite reasonable, but not cheap, somewhere around less than $15 after drink and tip for the least expensive but filling sampler lunch on the menu.

This place is a nice little Mexican restaurant. I had a carne asada taco and a chicken enchilada. The carne asada was amazing! The enchilada was decent. I will definitely recommend this place to friends.

I've eaten here 5 or 6 times over the last two years and the food is always great.  Service has always been good as well and I have never felt rushed to leave after the meal.  Decent prices as well.  We would definitely eat here more often if we lived closer.

Ate here with a friend that told me they had great salsa. She was right, however I don't get the salsa in a jar thing. My margarita was good too. My taco and enchilada combo was OK, but nothing great. I had asked for a side of sour cream, which I later found out on my bill cost me $2.00 for a tablespoon of sour cream! The server should have told me that, and I would have declined because that's insane - I deducted it from her tip, not to mention she seemed to want nothing to do with us.  The place is old and run down. The ceiling fan light that was over us was flickering and clearly needed to be changed. I think I almost had a seizure from all the flickering.   I haven't been back since, not saying that I wouldn't try it again, but was not impressed enough to want to come back.

This is definitely a hidden gem! My boyfriend and I have seen this place on Yelp for awhile and we are so glad we finally tried it. The food was super fresh and delicious! Can't wait to come back again!
Always good.  Staff pleasant and attentive and the food portions are generous.  We are regulars.  Highly recommend the spinach enchiladas or taco salad.  Both are excellent
Very good food. Not a fancy place but a great place to get good tasting food. The was oven hot. Very fresh.

This is one of the oldest still-running restaurants in the area. It shares a name with one of the newest restaurants on Park Avenue in New York, but is completely unrelated. In fact, I'm sure the experience you'll have here is just about the opposite.  It's in a location that the 70s Historical Preservation Society must be fighting to keep alive. I'd like to say it has character, but this old poorly designed strip should probably be nuked from space. However, you can't really complain too much when it's one of the few remaining old-school Mexican joints in town.   It's clean, everyone is nice, and the atmosphere inside is cozy. As my mother said... if you eat here, you can pretty much plan on going home smelling like Mexican food. Whether that's a good or bad thing can be up to you.   The food is just slightly above average for this type of place. Chips were okay. I put the salsa as below average. It was flavorless, but hot. The cheese crisp was good... not too oily. The guac was good. My entree was decent. It's the type of place that serves you standard old-school dishes - generally an ugly 70s plate full of grease with a sea of beans and slop and cheese and whatnot on the side. Same story as many other places. Too much to eat, and basically none of it is healthy, and basically all of it will either constipate you or clean you out.  The margaritas were pretty good. I would eat and drink here again I suppose if someone else was paying. This is your mom and dad's joint. Wish it was better.
Food is bomb.  Love the small town feel.  Great service.  Love the fajitas and chips and salsa.  Drinks are good too.
Great salsa.  Solid service.  Love the location and space.  The shredded beef tamale and taco were delicious.

I love Mexican food, I always test the salsa and chips to see if it will be good. I was not disappointed. And then I found out they have a all you can eat Mexican food buffet that I heard was great, I am going to try that this week. I always have the cheese enchiladas which comes with rice and refried beans they were the best refried beans I ever had. A must place to go for great Mexican food.

Servers were friendly.  The Del Sol Combination dinner I ordered was truly delicious. The tortilla chips were probably the best I have ever had!   The place is cozy and casual with wall paintings and mirrors. It looks like Mexico and it is very much an authentic Mexican restaurant independently owned.  Even though the price seems to be a little (by a couple of dollars) on the higher side, I would definitely go there again!

La Fonda is located next to Oregano's on Shea.  It's a small little Mexican restaurant, but the food is really good.  The salsa is delish and the margaritas can always bring a smile to my face.  They're really strong, like a good margarita should be, and purchasing a pitcher of them mid-day when I should be working, makes them taste even better.  The waiters are friendly and fast, and I've never had a bad experience there.  It's a casual place, so you can come dressed however you want, and it's the perfect spot for a quick meal.  I've never had to wait for a table either- which is good for me, but probably not so great for the restaurant.   A couple of times, I've come here instead of going to Oregano's when they have their two hour wait going on, and I'm always glad I did.  Give it a try next time you're in the area!

Yum Yum! Great chips and salsa, phenomenal service. Soda is always nasty, no matter what I order. The food is great! Their green corn tamale takes the cake as best tamale, and with chicken over it it is delightful. Tostadas, taco salads, taquitoes, just about everything here has been delicious. Great enchiladas, etc. They have amazing refried beans, really some of the best. Very friendly atmosphere. We go here all the time. While their cheese crisps are by no means crispy, the cheese they use is amazing, and I often crave it. I have it with their salsa and its awesome. Even though Im normally fond of crispy cheese crisps, this is addictive! Love La Fonda Del Sol cant wait to return!

This place has been in Scottsdale forever and I can tell why. I've been here a few times, each time the staff has been very friendly and accommodating, their salsa is bomb and I recommend the steak fajitas!

Was in a bit of a rush so we tried their buffet. It really was 1 step below a happy hour taco bar. There were no tortillas, 15 min wait after alerting them they brought out 5. The selection of items makes it tough to find even 2 things you would want (I'm not being picky, I know it's a buffet). I really hate to sound this harsh, but it really was not good and had no value for money. If this is the level they can provide for the price they should just discontinue it. I probably won't return even though menu items might be better, the experience left me so dissapointed I can't find a reason to try again.
Salsa=5 star. Very good cheap mexican food.  If you're into beef taco's like I am you will love this place.

Best Mexican food in Scottsdale. Fresh chips and homemade salsa. Fajitas were wonderful period been coming here for years and always have consistency in the food service and atmosphere. Great price for quality food.
Hole in the Wall that has been in Scottsdale a long time. Not very large so go in on slow time. Great food, great salsa and just as good margaritas. Visiting in Scottsdale, must try- Inexpensive!

This is really good Mexican food on a budget. The decor is standard, the service is wonderful, and the food is amazing. I have been to this location several times and have been pleased with everything I have ever ordered. The tostadas and the chimichingas really stand out in my memory.  Their chips and salsa are some of the best I have tasted.

My Son absolutely loves this place and he describes as his favorite Resteraunt. Enjoyed  for at least ten years and one year he insisted on having his birthday dinner at La Fonda. The staff use to tease him about getting a job when he turned sixteen. We moved away last year and it has been that long since we visited. Went for the buffet and as usual my Son gave it five stars. I love the soft tacos and he loves the buffet. The buffet is huge and for Approx $9.00 you get all you can eat. For a growing boy this is the bomb!  I love the Margaritas as well. Always clean and very polite. It's your neighborhood Resteraunt and the same people have worked in the establishment for years!!!!!

Have been here several times and they are consistent with a couple of things.  First off the chips and salsa rock!  The hot salsa is very tasty and the chips are usually hot and fresh.  The taco plate is always a winner.  And the service usual is usually iffy.  It's good 50% of the time.   For the food that you get the price is very reasonable.  I will def go back, even if it's just for the chips and salsa, since after all that's what good Mexican food is all about!! (stay away from the older woman/manager...she is RUDE!!  and don't even TRY to use a restaurant.com gift certificate..she will cut you!  lol)
The food was not good. We ordered tacos to go. Though we ordered the same item some came with soft and some hard tortilla...weird. No good flavors or textures. Skip this place!
The best Salsa, great margarita's, very friendly staff, I've only been in 3x over a 2 month period and the waitress remember my name each time I come in.

When they bring the chips and salsa, ask for a straw.  Stick it in the mild salsa container and suck until the container is empty.  This will be the culinary height of the meal.  I ordered the Armando Combination so that I could try different things.  Don't do that.  I heard a waitress suggest the Carne Burrito.  Too late for my order.  The food, simply said, was bland.  The mild salsa was a medley of fresh ingredients in just the right mix.  Awesome.   The interior was classic small Mexican restaurant.  The service was fine.  Honestly, another visit is necessary to make a final decision.  But until then, I have to agree with Kansas G.  So, if you came for the food review, you can move on.  If you are interested in a little social commentary, please read on.  [Steps up on soapbox]  1) I really wish someone had warned me that this was "loud talker night" at La Fonda.  I'd have gone tomorrow.  2) Memo to the F-bomb boys across the restaurant: This isn't a saloon or some spit on the floor, get piss drunk night out at the pool hall.  So could you please keep the F-bomb laced conversation for the ride home?  I realize you were here on "loud talker night" but that only intensified the offensiveness.  Don't get me wrong, I love a great profanity-laced conversation as much as the next guy, just not at dinner.  3) While I'm sure that you believe that the $3.95/month you're paying for that shitty and annoying ringtone is a great investment, Harley-wearin'-F-bomb dude, I don't want to hear it at dinner.  Put the F-er on F-ing vibrate, please.  Does that help?  4) And then, once you answer the shitty ringtone call, please realize that the dude on the other end of the line does not hear you any better if you YELLLLL.  Of course I do, complete with the F-bombs.  [Stands down from soapbox]  What the hell is happening to our manners?  Thanks for listening.
Love the food and the atmosphere. The staff is so nice.  Love their pollo fundido.  Gotta love a good locally owned, small pace! Love it, I bring company to this restaurant whenever they're in town!

The food here is amazing! All of it is home made and fresh. The enchiladas could be made corn or flour and the corn chicken enchiladas were very good. The amount of cheese and flavoring was perfect. The chips were freshly made and came out not warm but HOT. The La Fonda burrito was good and filling to the last bite. The  flan was delicious specially the whip cream. Of course the house margarita hit the spot for a Friday night. Great place, everyone there is very friendly... We will return.

We love this place and have been going there for twenty years. The food is authentic and reasonably priced. It has a family atmosphere. The chimichangas are incredible. La Fonda is a fantastic neighborhood Mexican restaurant. Great food and easy to get in and out of quickly.

This is quite possibly my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  My boyfriend and I frequently visit Phoenix and usually try a new restaurant every time. After eating here on our last trip to PHX we decided we had to come ever single time now. I got the"mini sampler plate". It was a perfect amount of everything (tamale, tostada, taco and cheese enchilada). All of it was excellent. My boyfriend got the nachos,we could not believe the amount of food that it was!  Our server was very attentive, and the atmosphere is excellent.  Overall a very nice Mexican Restaurant!
The food is still great here but we've stopped going. I don't know if it is the ventilation but the way you smell afterwards is just too incredibly strong and yucky.

Gave this a lot of thought before posting . I've been here 3 times.   I like the food. Price to portion is good value. 4 stars. Nothing is a stand out. Good American-ized Mexican food. Good chips, salsa and hot sauce. They have Fanta!  Service is spotty. 3 to 5 stars.  Dining room is every bit the dive. But it's clean. 5 stars. See "restrooms" below.   Consistent with being a dive, the menu has mis-prints. "Cream cheese." On Mexican food? Probably mean sour cream, I think. Either that or the cream cheese is super sour and soupy!  Restrooms are out of the 1970s. 0 stars. Just avoid them. Probably costs too much to remodel which would force ADA compliance and cut into their dining area.  I imagine this place does just fine without worrying about fixing anything.   Definitely coming back.

Like many people, we ended up at La Fonda thanks to an hour+ wait at Oreganos. It's nothing fancy and I wouldn't recommend this place for a date night or a night to impress anyone by ambiance, but I have to admit that the food was fantastic. And if there's one thing my family knows about - it's Mexican Food.   I had a simple Bean & Cheese Burrito enchilada style and it was delicious. It was moist and filled with tons of beans and cheese and the enchilada sauce was great. My mother-in-law go the salad with fresh grilled pineapple, mango and chicken and it was delicious as well. The chips and salsa were pretty good (I still prefer Aunt Chiladas) but the service was quick, the vibe was mellow and the food was tasty.   I don't live in the area and won't be driving out of my way to come back, but I'd recommend it if you're in the area and looking for some good Mexican.  Note: the combination entrees seemed a little pricey to me. We each got al-a-cart items which came with sour cream, lettuce & tomato and were plenty big.
Service was horrible for my takeout order. The only person to help was the hostess and she was the only to even say a word to me. But the food was great!

I live a few minutes from La Fonda and tried it for the first time last night and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. From the outside it doesn't really look like anything special, but the food was great and the service was good. I really enjoyed my topoppo salad and their salsas are delicious! I wasn't thrilled with my margarita, but that was my only qualm. I'm happy to have found good Mexican in my neighborhood!

Great prices, great food, great taste, great staff...no horchata or Jamaica though! Nonetheless, the reason for the 4 stars is I've had better not-too-far, though for the immediate area they are probably the best in the 1-1.5 mile radius though, including "the one across the street" (so far, my opinion).

Very popular local restaurant. The food and chips were surprisingly warm and hot. This is a delightful small cafe in a very busy part of town. If you are in a hurry it is nice to have the buffet  as an option.

Been a customer since 1991. Totally crave this place and not many others compare. Shredded beef taco and Chimi special are superior. Chips served warm and are light and crispy. Yum!!! Accented by the best salsas. Great food and large portions.
Great nachos and everything is made fresh to order. highly recommend the Cadillac margarita on the rocks

Walked in at 11am and ordered beef burro to go.  It had shredded beef and came with side of salsa and side of some red chilli sauce and a bag of fresh tortilla chips. The salsa/Pico and red sauce were good.  The beef was good but it was watery because it was stewed in onions, tomatoes, celery and ??? It was tasty but it got the burro soggy after awhile...eat it fast and get plenty of napkins. or ask for more foil to hold it together.

Decent food, not authentic Mexican food but it is filling, salsas are a little better than the Salsa Picante Pace, waiter was helpful but since they were closing, was a bit pushy to get us out, place closes at 9pm which is strange where I come from, all Mexican restaurants close at 1 or 2 AM, kind of disappointed at Mexican food in this town

I really enjoyed this place.  It is like a diner inside, seating and such... the food is wonderful.  I love the salsa containers...cute.  The food was great, plenty of it too!  I had a full meal and my husband had only a taco.  We shared the rice and beans I got, and we were both stuffed!  Margarita was great and his beer was icy cold and great too!

This was not enjoyable. The service was good and our server was attentive. We were not impressed with the food. The salsa had so much onion and cilantro that we could not taste the tomatoes. It was overwhelming with onion favor. The queso was very similar to nacho cheese dip from a can, it was not the traditional white Mexican cheese, it was bright yellow. My tacos were cold.

This place has been here for a very long time. They do a decent job but in the last couple years I have thought they have lost some of the quality of the food as well as the service. Many other Mexican places to choose from in the neighborhood.

I used to babysit for the previous owner's kids when I was a teen and they'd bring home La Fonda food for their children, but never give me any and I'd be so jealous. I was always curious about this restaurant's food so I finally tried it. It was just okay. In fact, I'd give 2 stars but the rest of my family liked it so I'm giving 3.  My chicken taco was dry and bland. The red enchilada sauce had no flavor at all. The salsa was super yummy and fresh, though.   I won't ever go back - primarily because their ceiling fans cause the lights to flicker, which can trigger migraines, and which I'm prone to. If you get migraines, steer clear!

If you want grease, come here.  If you want to feel like there is a giant ball of lard sitting at the bottom of your stomach, come here.  If you want diarrhea for the next 24 hours due to stomach lubrication, come here.  I went to La Fonda's because of the name. La Fonda reminded me of  the chick in Neapolitan Dynamite.  We set down and you can tell this place is family owned. There we're young teenagers waiting on the table, and their english wasn't even that great. After I received my enchiladas/beans/rice plate, I looked down to see a HUGE pile of grease.  Beans are what you'd expect from a can you buy at the store. No real flavor, nothing special. The rice was on the plain side too. Pretty authentic, but lacked flavor. Good sauce on the enchilada, but boy that pool of grease made me quiver.  Hot hot chips, decent salsa.  What can I say? I won't be back again. I like my Mexican food more fresh, but that's just me.

HAIR in my food.   My waitress apologized and said that she would comp my meal.  However, that didn't happen.  The woman who I assume is the owner told the waitress that she could take off a whopping 10%. Unreal!!'

Well I've promised to put a few reviews on here to get past my joining Yelp just to vent my frustrations with one (now defunct) business.  So, I can think of no better restaurant to start with than La Fonda.  I've been coming here since I was kid; it was my father's favorite Mexican joint, and it is now mine and my son's as well!  My son and I have dinner alone together once a week and have made La Fonda our restaurant of choice!  The chips can be a bit greasy (hence not 5 stars), but they're always hot and fresh, and the salsa's hands down the best in town.  None of that cooked, tastes like it came from a jar stuff; just fresh tomatoes, onions, cilantro, etc.-- it's so good, I could inhale it.  Being the creatures of habit we are, Jacob and I always get the same things every week. (Nowadays, we just order "the usual.")  For Jacob, it's a cheese crisp with guacamole, for me, it's a machaca burro and a side of beans.  I've had other things in the past...  the tamales are wonderful too, but I absolutely LOVE the machaca.  It's tender, crispy and fried up with lots of onions and peppers.  It's delicious!!  The beans are good too, but beans are beans; it's the machaca I keep coming back for.   As for the atmosphere, it can definitely get a bit loud in there when it's busy.  The sound just seems to reverberate off the tile and concrete.  And...  pray that no one near you orders fajitas, or you will (guaranteed!) smell like them for the rest of the evening.   But, again, I am addicted to the machaca and therefore find the rest to be mere trifles.  What more can I say-- I love La Fonda.

Very good Mexican food and fresh hot tortilla chips! It's been years since I've been here but was glad the food is still top notch. I ordered the chicken fundido with beans and rice and my spouse had the chicken enchiladas with rice and beans. Both were delicious and filling. Will be back again for sure!
